reviews.review_msg: One of the best lecturers I've had, he really opens your eyes to the material which encourages fundamental understanding of the topics. He puts a lot of effort in each lecture which allows you to just listen and write or stop and contemplate. Very kind grader with great feedback but tests are hard and his custom assignments are killer but also fun.

Prof Hayden seems to genuinely care about students, and enjoy teaching. My one complaint is that he gives very little time for quizzes and midterms, leading to rushing and mistakes. He adjusts grading for the final and later midterms though, so although stressful, the time shouldn't affect marks too much.

I took PHYS421 with him. I am glad that I have received a grade of A with him. I studied daily for at least 6 hours for this course. Sadly, I cannot apply things I learned in class to my own life/career. Although I graduate few years ago, I still remember every single question in the exams.
Super great lectures, very helpful and passionate about the subject. Difficult class because you really need to know the material

Mike's lectures are the best ones I have ever taken in my 3 years at SFU. He is also accessible outside of the classes, as he has a open office door policy. But be careful if you are taking his course: his tests and exams are very difficult and requires you to really understand the material to do well.
Great at explaining things in a way thats easy to understand. Super interested in the subject, and more than willing to help students with any and all concerns.
horrible final exam.

The best science teacher ever!Extremely helpful to questions. Interesting lecture and clear explanation.He is always ready to help and make students feel in ease when going to his office. The exam will not be hard if you understand the material. Everything is well related! I hope I can take class with him again!
Kept the whole class pretty interesting, although sometimes he doesn't 'dumb-down' his explanations enough. Exams are really hard too I found, but lectures are never boring with all the demos.

Very hard course. He's a very helpful prof. If you go to his office hours he's more than happy to explain questions and concepts. But his exams are ridiculously hard. You should talk to people who have taken the course before to get a grasp of the exams. Also hw is mandatory. Try to do as many other text problems as you can. They will def help

Super nice guy. Many times stood after class with me answering my questions. He makes the course easy to understand and fun course, amazing since I had never taken physics before. Really wants students to do well, and weights your mark most favorably-- HUGE GPA booster.

By far the best prof to date I've had at SFU! I always looked forward to going to class because it was just like going to science world: he does super fun and cool experiments every single class that really explain concepts and made the class exciting.
This guy is by far the best teacher I've had at SFU. He was so dedicated and taught the class impeccably. Bravo.

This prof goes into his own world when teaching, which should b a gd thing, since he's THAT interested in phys, however, he goes on way too fast, does not stop to verify that students r understanding the material or not.  this course is extra hard for engineering students as we jump from 1st yr to 3rd yr phys, hw is much needed to help comprehend

Nice, cheerful and dedicated professor. Perhaps a great transition course for people fresh from high school ready to adjust to university. Took this course as an elective and the work load was very minimal. He does skim through the chapters fairly fast towards the end of the semester, but if you read the text regularly, you should be fine.

He was the worst prof I have ever had. He doesn't care about his students and is just there to get paid and do boring physics research. Don't ever take his class. You are wasting your money. He doesn't deserve the title as professor.

Most awesome class ever; it's so fun. Even if you aren't very good at science, don't let the whole physics thing scare you: the concepts are not hard and he has these awesome demos to keep the course interesting. Take it!!!!
awesome.

Talks and writes veryyyyyyy fast.. uses every single second of the lecutre time productively... one minute left of lecture to him means he can teach another chapter of the book... never pauses for questions to verify student understanding..he just enters his own physics world when he's teaching. H.W. should be mandatory so stdents keep up with clas
never taken a physics course before. even so i found this course a blast. best prof i've ever had!

Amazing prof - one of the best! Extremely helpful outside of office hours. Very patient. Clear notes/instructions & great demos. Get ready to take tonnes of notes if you are not a science student. Fascinating & fun course. Use the chapter questions to study for the exams!!

Very difficult class (especially if you're not a phys, engineering student).  Good teacher, enjoyed going to class due to demos but he expects way too much from you.  Spent more hours/week on this class then any other and ended up doing the worst.  Avoid if possible.

Teaches fine but the class/prof expects way too much out of you.  I spent the most time on this class than any of my others and it still ended up being my worst mark.  Demos are very interesting but the exams are crazy hard.  Avoid this class if possible.
Horrible exams, but scaled. So it's possible to fail one of the MTs and the final and get a B. (I guess)
Very entertaining to watch in action, but the tests are tough if you don't work at it.
I don't see the point of making the exam soo hard, and letting the class average to be around 20%.  Whats the point of doing that???
I like his use of classroom experiments, set-up by his sneaky assistant; if it weren't for sneaky, there'd be no point in coming to class. Go sneaky.

I absolutely do not agree with people saying that he teaches well in class. However, when it comes to one on one he's very helpful and patient... but unfortunately it does not make the exams easier for you even if you think you have bombarded him with a huge amount of questions... Conclusion, EVADE!

Hayden is pretty good at teaching our class. However, my hand was sore everytime I get out of the class (from the taking notes, and stop thinking dirty!). Exams are hard though, but I somehow nailed the first midterm, lol.
smiley. cute. super helpful. cares about students. it's worth getting up in the morning for his class even though it's a first year one.  way to go hayden!
what are you whiny people talking about? he is the one of the best profs i've ever had.  always smiling, always willing to help.
Should be teaching high-school English.
great proff! very knowledgeable and interresting. people should stop complaining about the fact that everyone miserably failed (most got like 20% before scaling) but then again i nailed it.
he sucks! worst class i've ever taken. his exams are way too hard.

Horrible prof., shouldn't be teaching.  Comes up with the most bizzar questions for tests, and gives ABSOLUTELY no prep.-no samples, and gives extremely simplified examples in class.  Avoid him at all cost...I know less now than i knew entering the class.

He knows his so well unlike some other profs @ sfu. He knows his physics right from where it orginated. BUT TESTS ARE KILLER. His notes help a little bit for the test. neardy person can do well on the test. Tests are too hard.
AMAZING prof.  really really cares about his students, great lecturer, knows material extremely well.  deserves a teaching award

Although it may not seem like it at first, the class is straighforward and simple. The only new material you learn is in the first 1/3. The rest is all review (using calculus on grade 11/12 material). The prof's organized and scales the tests :)

Very graceful and energetic. doesn't he remind you of jack from will and grace? He is so helpful when you actually talk to him and so very friendly and welcoming. the organization is amazing. keep up the good work
No Comments
No Comments

very smart, super nice. Excellent enthusiasm and yes, makes physics really interesting! Seems to know everything and can explain it too. Not easy for an average-brainer but still a fantastic teacher, both in knowledge and personality.
Nice prof!!
fantastic prof!  made physics fun.  very approachable... cares about his students
Very good nature, actually enjoys teaching!..deserved better marks
the BEST prof i've ever had - made me want to major in physics
Although his test are super hard, you can really learn from him.Phys can be fun!
very willing to help students. high class avg
man... don't rush in the end of the semester
Very cheerful but hard midterms avg 50%
Mediocre textbooks, but excellent lectures.  Also easy to get in touch with
No Comments
No Comments
midterms aren't unfair, they just require you actually understand the material.
He spends too much time on the easy stuff and brushes over the hard stuff
No Comments
good prof
No Comments
No Comments
Exam is totally different than capa and problems in the book
No Comments
really hard midterms but it's all worth it
one of the best profs i've ever had
Good prof
No comment.....
Clear, friendly, simply the best professor in SFU
A quite helpful and funny professor!
